content.question:
Directions: The suggested time for answering this question is about 22 minutes. Where calculations are required, clearly show how you arrived at your answer. Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.

Shown above is a graph of the gross domestic product (GDP) per capita versus the annual electrical energy consumption per capita for nine countries in 2009.

Iceland’s position on the graph is due in part to its access to geothermal energy sources. Describe how electricity is generated from a geothermal source.

Despite its low GDP per capita and low annual electrical energy consumption per capita, China has become the world’s largest emitter of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> . Explain this apparent contradiction.

In addition to contributing to increased atmospheric <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> concentrations, China is facing other air pollution issues related to the generation of electricity. Identify one such issue and describe the impact it has on human health.

Two countries shown on the graph have developed domestic energy sources: sugarcane in Brazil and tar sands in western Canada.

Choose EITHER sugarcane or tar sands, then briefly describe the process of fuel production from that energy source.

Describe TWO disadvantages of using the energy source that you chose in part (d)(i).

Which of the two energy sources is more sustainable? Justify your answer with an explanation.

frqParts.text:

Shown above is a graph of the gross domestic product (GDP) per capita versus the annual electrical energy consumption per capita for nine countries in 2009.

Iceland’s position on the graph is due in part to its access to geothermal energy sources. Describe how electricity is generated from a geothermal source.

Despite its low GDP per capita and low annual electrical energy consumption per capita, China has become the world’s largest emitter of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> . Explain this apparent contradiction.

In addition to contributing to increased atmospheric <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mtext>CO</mtext> </mrow> <mtext>2</mtext> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@386E@</annotation> </semantics> </math> concentrations, China is facing other air pollution issues related to the generation of electricity. Two countries shown on the graph have developed domestic energy sources: sugarcane in Brazil and tar sands in western Canada.

Choose EITHER sugarcane or tar sands, then briefly describe the process of fuel production from that energy source.

Describe TWO disadvantages of using the energy source that you chose in part (d)(i).

Which of the two energy sources is more sustainable? Justify your answer with an explanation.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe environmental concepts and processes.
